Module it.polimi.ingsw.gc12
Package it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Network

Class SocketHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Network.NetworkSession
it.polimi.ingsw.gc12.Network.SocketHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SocketClientHandler, SocketServerHandler
public abstract class SocketHandler extends NetworkSession
The SocketHandler class is an abstract representation of a network session utilizing socket-based communication in a client-server architecture.

This class extends NetworkSession and provides functionality to handle communication with clients or servers over TCP sockets. Implementations of this class are responsible for linking the executions of the received commands and handling the management of logging errors.

Subclasses must implement the executeReceivedCommand(Command) method to define custom behavior for processing received commands. The implementation of the printError(Exception) method is subject to the desired behavior on client or server.

See Also:
  • for the base class providing additional functionality
  • for the structure of commands exchanged between client and server
  • Serialized Form

    • read

      public void read() throws IOException

      Throws:

    • sendRequest

      protected void sendRequest(Command command) throws IOException
      Sends a command to the client or server.

      This method adds the command to the write queue, writes it to the output stream, and manages synchronization with other write operations. If the queue contains more than one command that has to be written, the requester will wait and then be notified when the previous write action has been fulfilled.

      Parameters:
      command - The command to be sent.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while writing the command.

    • executeReceivedCommand

      protected abstract void executeReceivedCommand(Command receivedCommand)
      Executes a received command.

      Subclasses must implement this method to define custom behavior for processing commands received from the client or server.

      Parameters:
      receivedCommand - The command received from the client or server.

    • printError

      public abstract void printError(Exception e)
      Handles the printing of error messages. Subclasses must implement this method to define how error messages are handled or logged.
      Parameters:
      e - The exception representing the error.
